Curriculum

Mobile Track





Android 1-Day Crash Course

This one-day course will teach you the basics of building native mobile apps for Android.

  • Using and configuring Android Developer Tools Bundle (including Eclipse and the Android SDK)
  • Hello World
  • Java language basics
  • User interface layout with XML
  • Multiple views
  • Sandbox time with 1-on-1 support from our instructional team
  • Tips for next steps

Course Dates

Recently Completed!





iPhone 1-Day Crash Course

This one-day course will teach you the basics of native iOS development using Apple's Xcode development environment. By the end of the day, you will have created your own iPhone application.

  • How to use the Xcode IDE and iOS SDK
  • Hello World
  • Objective-C language basics
  • User Interface design with Storyboards
  • Connecting multiple views and using Tab bars
  • Importing external images
  • Introduction to MapKit and CoreLocation frameworks
  • Sandbox time with 1-on-1 support from our instructional team

Course Dates

January 19th Register





iOS 2-Day Advanced Course

This two-day course will teach you advanced iOS (iPhone, iPad) development. The course is designed for people with some prior experience in object-oriented programming and the Xcode development environment.

  • Multi-view applications
  • Working with external APIs
  • Using various frameworks from the iOS SDK
  • Using AutoLayout controls
  • New design paradigms in iOS 7
  • Designing Universal applications with different iPhone and iPad Views
  • Sandbox time with 1-on-1 support from our instructional team

Course Dates

TBD

Web Track





Basic Web Development 1-Day Crash Course

This one-day course will teach you the basics of HTML and CSS. It will also cover several popular ways to get a website online including Weebly, Wordpress, and self-hosting.

  • Overview of front-end web technologies including HTML and CSS
  • How to use a text editor, FTP client, and Google Chrome web developer tools
  • Setting up a local development environment
  • Publishing a website with Weebly, Tumblr, and Wordpress.com
  • Collecting user data through the Forms tool in Google Drive
  • Embedding media content, including images, YouTube videos, and Tweets
  • Registering a domain name and deploying to a web server
  • Introduction to web frameworks including Bootstrap and JQuery
  • Sandbox time with 1-on-1 support from our instructional team

Course Dates

February 15th Register





Ruby on Rails 1-Day Crash Course

This one-day course will teach you the basics of the Ruby language and the Rails development framework.

  • Using a virtual environment with VirtualBox and Vagrant
  • Working with a text editor and the command line
  • Configuring Ruby and Rails development environments
  • Hello world
  • Overview of the Ruby language and Object-Oriented Programming paradigm
  • Introduction the Rails framework
  • Building your first Rails application
  • Deployment via Heroku
  • Sandbox time with 1-on-1 support from our instructional team

Course Dates

TBD





PHP 1-Day Crash Course

This one-day course will teach you the basics of building dynamic websites with PHP and MySQL.

  • Setting up the LAMP stack (Linux, Apache, MySQL, PHP) and its variants
  • Introduction to the PHP language
  • Hello world
  • Using PHP to create dynamic HTML pages
  • Collecting form data
  • Using PHPMyAdmin to view and edit MySQL tables
  • Pulling data from APIs
  • Sandbox time with 1-on-1 support from our instructional team

Course Dates

January 26th Register





Python 1-Day Crash Course

This one-day course will teach you the basics of programming with Python with an introduction to the Django web development framework.

  • Working with a text editor and the command line
  • Configuring Python and Django development environments
  • Hello world
  • Overview of the Python language and basic programming principles
  • Introduction the Django framework
  • Building your first Django application
  • Introduction to using Python libraries
  • Sandbox time with 1-on-1 support from our instructional team

Course Dates

TBD





JavaScript 1-Day Crash Course

This one-day course will teach you the basics of interactive webpages using JavaScript.

  • Overview of the JavaScript language and programming paradigms
  • Working with the DOM
  • JavaScript libraries including JQuery
  • Sandbox time with 1-on-1 support from our instructional team

Course Dates

TBD

Game Track





Unity 1-Day Crash Course

This one-day course will teach you the basics of video game development with Unity Game Engine.

  • Using the Unity Game Engine development environment
  • Working with rigid body game elements
  • Overview of physics and collisions
  • Programming with the C# language using MonoDevelop
  • Working with textures and sounds
  • Sandbox time with 1-on-1 support from our instructional team

Course Dates

TBD

K-12 Student / Teacher Track





Hour of Code

A one-hour introduction to Computer Science through a variety of interactive tutorials, specially-designed for K-12 students.

  • Logic and Loops with a maze activity featuring Angry Birds and Plants vs Zombies
  • Learning variables, functions, and Javascript syntax with Codecademy
  • Creating shapes from code with Processing.org
  • Learning coding and program execution with My Robotic Friends from ThinkerSmith
  • 1-on-1 support from our instructional team

Course Dates

December 9 - 13, 2013





Day of Code

A one-day experience for middle and high school students interested in programming. By the end of the course, students will have a basic understanding of variables, logic, and loops, experience with JavaScript syntax, and will have written at least 2 of their own programs.

  • Introduction to Computer Science concepts
  • Building games with Scratch
  • The basics of writing code with Javascript
  • Integrating Javascript in to an HTML page
  • Setting up accounts on Scratch and Codecademy (to continue work after the course)
  • Sandbox time with 1-on-1 support from our instructional team

Course Dates

March 1st Register





Week of Code

This week-long coding camp for middle and high school students will provide a survey of popular computer programming skills. By the end of the course, students will have built at least 1 web page, mobile app, and video game using HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Scratch, Android, and Unity 3D.

  • Introduction to Computer Science concepts with Scratch
  • Learning to write code with KidsRuby
  • Web Development with HTML, CSS, Javascript, and Ruby on Rails
  • Mobile App Development with Android
  • Video Game Development with Unity 3D
  • Sandbox time with 1-on-1 support from our instructional team
  • Final project presentations at the end of the week

Course Dates

TBD





Professional Development - #learntocode for Teachers

This one-day course is meant for educators who want to integrate basic computer programming activities into their curriculum.

  • How computers work (hardware and software)
  • Introduction to Computer Science (logic, control, algorithms)
  • Overview of programming languages
  • Activities on a variety of popular learn-to-code platforms (Scratch, Codecademy, Khan Academy)
  • Sandbox time with 1-on-1 support from our instructional team
